DataElement.preferredName: International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification Mitosis Karyorrhexis Index Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the component of the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC) for mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuroblastoma International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification Histology
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma is a specific type of neuroblastic tumor which is characterized by the presense of neuroblastic cells forming groups or nests separated by delicate stromal septa without prominent Schwannian stroma. (Adapted from WHO.)_A classification system established by adopting the original system proposed by Shimada with subsequent revisions. The INPC distinguishes favorable and unfavorable histology groups._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma is a specific type of neuroblastic tumor which is characterized by the presense of neuroblastic cells forming groups or nests separated by delicate stromal septa without prominent Schwannian stroma. (Adapted from WHO.)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A classification system established by adopting the original system proposed by Shimada with subsequent revisions. The INPC distinguishes favorable and unfavorable histology groups.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: A classification system established by adopting the original system proposed by Shimada with subsequent revisions. The INPC distinguishes favorable and unfavorable histology groups.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Reviewed and approved for release by T.Davidsen. mc 7/24/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification Mitosis-Karyorrhexis Index Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of between 100 and 200 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

Concepts.definition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of between 100 and 200 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of less than 100 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

Concepts.definition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of less than 100 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of more than 200 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

Concepts.definition: An index used in neuroblastic tumors indicating the presence of more than 200 mitoses and karyorrhexis per 5,000 cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to replace coded values with character terms as part of TARGET harmonization project per request by T. Davidsen. mc 12/1/2014

ReferenceDocuments.name: TARGET Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: If INPC MKI is missing, then this is Shimada MKI.  When multiple nodules present in a single Ganglioneuroblastoma, nodular tumor, the higher MKI value is reported.
